channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today: Saturday, January 31 Clues And Answers (#965)
item.description: Looking for today's NYT Connections hints? Some help and the answers for today's game are right here to help keep your streak alive.

item.title: Markiplier’s ‘Iron Lung’ Rotten Tomatoes Scores Are Near Perfect, So Far
item.description: Markiplier releases his promising Iron Lung horror movies on 2,500 screens this weekend, and its Rotten Tomatoes scores are great so far.

item.title: Kevin Warsh went from selling racetrack pencils to Trump’s new Fed chair pick. His advice for Gen Z: Merit is the ultimate currency in the workplace
item.description: Before Wall Street and Washington, Kevin Warsh sold pencils at a horse track. His secret for success is simple: work harder than everyone else—and lea...

item.title: The new Fed chair’s billionaire father-in-law is a friend of Trump’s from college and has business interests in Greenland
item.description: Trump’s pick of Kevin Warsh pairs an inflation hawk with a deep Trumpworld connection through Ronald Lauder, a friend to the president for 60 years.

item.title: The ‘Bridgerton’ Season 4 Part 2 Release Date Is Another Disappointment
item.description: The Bridgerton season 4 part 2 release date is awkwardly far away, continuing a disappointing Netflix tradition that they insist on keeping.

item.title: Tech CFOs face a new challenge: Selling unprecedented capex as ‘disciplined’
item.description: Meta and Microsoft CFOs frame AI spending as disciplined, demand-driven.

item.title: Trump expands trade war with Canada, threatening 50% aircraft tariff
item.description: The president said he was retaliating against Canada for refusing to certify jets from Savannah, Georgia-based Gulfstream Aerospace.

item.title: Tariffs may have cost US economy thousands of jobs monthly, Fed analysis reveals
item.description: A new Fed study estimates tariffs cost the U.S. economy 19,000 jobs per month in 2025, potentially raising unemployment by 0.1 percentage points.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
